title: Heterologous protein expression in E. coli

protocol.title: Heterologous protein expression in E. coli
protocol.title_html: Heterologous protein expression in E. coli

source.description:
Prepare the following buffers:
10X PBS
Dissolve the following in 800 mL H2O:
  • 80 g of NaCl (1.37 M)
  • 2.0 g of KCl (27 mM)
  • 14.4 g of Na2HPO4 (100 mM)
  • 2.4 g of KH2PO4 (18 mM)
  • Adjust pH to 7.4.
  • Add H2O to 1L.
  • Autoclave
  • Store 10X stock at 4 °C from which you can dilute 1:10 to make 1X working stock to keep at room temp.
  • Re-suspension buffer
  • 50 mM Tris-HCl pH 8
  • 2 mM EDTA
  • Lysis buffer
  • 50 mM sodium phosphate pH 7.5 (adjust to ~1-2 units away from pI of expressed protein)
  • 300 mM sodium chloride
  • 10 mM imidazole
  • 5% glycerol
  • 10 mM 2-Mercaptoethanol or 1 mM DTT (if disulfide-bonds are a problem)
  • 1x Protease-inhibitor cocktail
  • Denaturing buffer
  • 6 M Urea
  • 4% CHAPS
  • 35 mM Tris-HCl pH 8
  • Adjust pH to 7.4.
  • Add H2O to 1L.
  • Autoclave
  • Store 10X stock at 4 °C from which you can dilute 1:10 to make 1X working stock to keep at room temp.
  • Re-suspension buffer
  • 50 mM Tris-HCl pH 8
  • 2 mM EDTA
  • Lysis buffer
  • 50 mM sodium phosphate pH 7.5 (adjust to ~1-2 units away from pI of expressed protein)
  • 300 mM sodium chloride
  • 10 mM imidazole
  • 5% glycerol
  • 10 mM 2-Mercaptoethanol or 1 mM DTT (if disulfide-bonds are a problem)
  • 1x Protease-inhibitor cocktail
  • Denaturing buffer
  • 6 M Urea
  • 4% CHAPS
  • 35 mM Tris-HCl pH 8
Store 10X stock at 4 °C from which you can dilute 1:10 to make 1X working stock to keep at room temp.
Re-suspension buffer
  • 50 mM Tris-HCl pH 8
  • 2 mM EDTA
  • Lysis buffer
  • 50 mM sodium phosphate pH 7.5 (adjust to ~1-2 units away from pI of expressed protein)
  • 300 mM sodium chloride
  • 10 mM imidazole
  • 5% glycerol
  • 10 mM 2-Mercaptoethanol or 1 mM DTT (if disulfide-bonds are a problem)
  • 1x Protease-inhibitor cocktail
  • Denaturing buffer
  • 6 M Urea
  • 4% CHAPS
  • 35 mM Tris-HCl pH 8
Lysis buffer
  • 50 mM sodium phosphate pH 7.5 (adjust to ~1-2 units away from pI of expressed protein)
  • 300 mM sodium chloride
  • 10 mM imidazole
  • 5% glycerol
  • 10 mM 2-Mercaptoethanol or 1 mM DTT (if disulfide-bonds are a problem)
  • 1x Protease-inhibitor cocktail
  • Denaturing buffer
  • 6 M Urea
  • 4% CHAPS
  • 35 mM Tris-HCl pH 8
Denaturing buffer
  • 6 M Urea
  • 4% CHAPS
  • 35 mM Tris-HCl pH 8
Transform desired E. coli cell strain with plasmid to be expressed using desired method (e.g. heat shock or electroporation depending on type of competency).

For electrocompetent cells:
- Add 0.5 - 1 µL purified plasmid to 50 µL cells (thawing on ice, 15 minutes)
- Gently flick with finger to mix
- Transfer mixer to chilled electroporation cuvette ensuring there are no bubbles. Keep on ice until ready to electroporate
- Set machine to 1.8 kV, 25 µF, 200-400 Ω
- Dry the outside of the cuvette and place into electroporation chamber.
- Prepare p1000 and p200 pipettes to be ready
- Close chamber and electroporate
- Immediately remove cuvette and add 1 mL LB. Transfer contents to microfuge tube using both p1000 and p200.
- Let cells recover at 37 ºC with ~200 rpm shaking for > 1 hour.

For chemically competent cells:
- Add 0.5 - 1 µL purified plasmid to 50 µL cells (thawing on ice, 15 minutes)
- Gently flick with finger to mix
- Sit on ice for 30 minutes, set water bath to heat to 42 ºC
- Depending on cells, incubate in water bath for 30 - 90 seconds.
- Return to ice for 5 minutes
- Add 1 mL LB and let cells recover at 37 ºC with ~200 rpm shaking for > 1 hour.

Plate recovered transformed cells (~100 µL of transformed cells) onto selective LB media and grow O/N @ 37 ºC. Adjust volume as needed in order to obtain single colonies that can be picked for subsequent innoculation.

Use single bacterial colony to inoculate into LB + appropriate antibiotic (if possible, make multiple inoculations with separate single colonies).
Use p100-200 pipette tip to scrape colony and drop into 3-5 mL broth in 10 mL culture tube. Grow O/N @ 37 ºC with ~200-250 rpm shaking.

Inoculate larger culture using the starter culture generated from Step 3 at 1:50 dilution (e.g. 0.5 mL in 25 mL LB + antibiotic).
Final culture volume will depend on downstream applications. Ensure use of an appropriate vessel to allow effective aeration (see suggestions in guidelines).
Grow larger culture at 37 ºC and check OD600 after 2.5 - 3 hours (time will vary depending on dilution, total culture volume, cell strain and quality, and aeration).

When OD600 is between 0.6 - 0.8, take an aliquot of culture (up to 15 mL) as a non-induced control.
To the remaining culture, add induction media. We typically use BL21 (DE3) derived strains and, thus, add IPTG to achieve [IPTG]final = 0.4 mM. You may need to find an optimal concentration of IPTG to achieve effective induction of protein expression vs toxicity to bacterial cells.
Grow cultures overnight (ideally at 18-25 ºC ). Measure OD600 for difference between induced vs non-induced. Non-induced should be higher by at least 0.1 (minimum difference).
It may be worthwhile testing for successful induction of recombinant protein expression on an aliquot (>1 mL) of induced culture.

Spin down culture at max speed for 3 minutes and remove supernatant.
Note, this pellet can be stored @ -20 ºC.
Resuspend cells in 100 μL 1X PBS (per 1 mL culture). Store the resuspended crude lysate at -20 °C when not in use.

Calculate how much crude lysate to load onto gel based on OD and concentration factor (CF):
CF = volume of culture / volume of resuspension (e.g. CF = 1 mL culture / 100 μL 1X PBS = 10x)
μL to load = [180/CF]/OD

To these volumes, add the appropriate amount of 4X LDS (or required SDS-PAGE sample buffer), [DTT]final = 50 mM, and [MgCl2]final = 100 mM. These should be calculated first, and a mastermix of LDS, DTT and MgCl2 can be prepared and added to samples accordingly.
Heat sample @ 72 ºC for 10 minutes in water bath.
Place samples on ice for 5 minutes then spin for 15 minutes at max speed.
Transfer supernatant to new tubes, taking care to avoid any "sticky" DNA coating the tube.
Run supernatant on SDS-PAGE gel and perform Coomassie staining. Alternatively, transfer to PVDF membrane and perform Western blot analysis (ideally, recombinant protein contains epitope tag).

To isolate soluble protein, re-suspend frozen, pelleted cells in an adequate volume of lysis buffer (alternatively, trial 1x PBS + 1 mg/mL lysosyme, however, proteins are likely to be unstable in this buffer).
Note: ensure pH of lysis buffer is >1 pH units away from the isoelectric point of your expressed protein.
Keep samples on ice at all times.

Sonicate samples with the Q125 ultrasonicator (125 watt, 20 kHz, 60% amp, 30 seconds).
Keep samples on ice during and between rounds of sonication.
Spin at 16,000g for 20 minutes at 4 °C.

To isolate the insoluble fraction; resuspend the remaining pellet in denaturing buffer (same volume as lysis buffer).
Repeat the sonication and centrifugation steps as per the soluble fraction. Recover supernatant in a clean tube.
Once OD600 difference of 0.1 is achieved, move cultures to ice and prepare chilled centrifuge.
Remove supernatant and wash cells in re-suspension buffer (practical volume to resuspend cells). Pellet as above and discard supernatant.
Snap-freeze pellet in LN2 and store at -80 ºC.
Pellet cells at 4 ºC (~7,000 rcf for 5 minutes with gentle stop).

Thaw cells on ice and aliquot appropriate volume of culture to microcentrifuge tube (can resuspend in small volume of re-suspension buffer). Store remaining cells at -80 ºC (avoid repeated freeze-thaws).

Perform a Bradford assay to determine protein concentration in the soluble and insoluble fractions. Use these concentrations to normalise input volumes for each sample to a desired loading amount (e.g. 3 µg).
Run samples on SDS-PAGE and stain gel with Coomassie or perform Western blot to verify expression.
Transfer cell re-suspension to clean microfuge tube (or appropriate vessel for probe sonication). Retain any remaining cell suspension at -20 °C.
Recover supernatant in a clean tube. Retain the pellet at -20 °C to for insoluble protein fraction.

materials.name: BL21(DE3) or BL21-Star(DE3) or Rosetta2(DE3) or etc for protein purification

description: Protocol for recombinant protein expression in E. coli for protein purification and subsequent enzyme assays, protein crystallography etc.
